item.title: Paramount goes to war with Netflix for Warner Bros. Discovery with hostile $108.4B bid
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Paramount Skydance on Monday launched a hostile, $108.4 billion bid to buy Warner Bros. Discovery, days after Warner Bros. agreed to be acquired by Netflix for $82.7 billion.

item.title: IBM to acquire Confluent for $11B as it seeks to bolster its data offerings
item.dc:creator: Ram Iyer
item.description: IBM is buying data infrastructure company Confluent for $11 billion in cash in a bid to to bolster its data and automation products as ever more companies move their tech operations to the cloud and deploy AI technology.

item.title: Adobe launches content creation hub in Premiere mobile for YouTube Shorts creators
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: The company says the space is designed to give creators everything they need to produce viral videos, grow their audience, and tap into trends, whether it's creating day-in-the-life vlogs, travel videos, or behind-the-scenes clips.

item.title: Hinge’s new AI feature helps daters move beyond boring small talk
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Hinge launched “Convo Starters,” a feature powered by AI that provides personalized tips for initiating meaningful conversations.

item.title: OpenAI boasts enterprise win days after internal ‘code red’ on Google threat
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: ChatGPT Enterprise usage grew 8x year-over-year as workers report saving an hour daily, but OpenAI faces competitive pressure from Anthropic and questions about cost sustainability.

item.title: Netflix co-CEO discussed Warner Bros. deal with Trump
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Will Netflix’s $82.7 billion deal to acquire Warner Bros. get approval from federal regulators? While Paramount was assumed to be the frontrunner to acquire the storied movie studio thanks to CEO David Ellison’s connections to the Trump administration, new reporting in Bloomberg and The Hollywood Reporter suggests that Netflix co-CEO Ted Sarandos met with President […]

item.title: X deactivates European Commission’s ad account after the company was fined €120M
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: X has seemingly penalized the European Commission's account after the commission fined the company over blue checkmarks and ad transparency.

item.title: The accelerator is on the floor for autonomous vehicles
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Welcome back to TechCrunch Mobility — your central hub for news and insights on the future of transportation.

item.title: Coinbase starts onboarding users again in India, plans for fiat on-ramp next year
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Coinbase is exploring expansion into India with a staggered relaunch and hiring for different roles.

item.title: OpenAI says it’s turned off app suggestions that look like ads
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: While OpenAI continues to insist that there are currently no ads — or tests for advertising — live in ChatGPT, the company’s chief research officer also acknowledged that the company “fell short” with recent promotional messages.

item.title: Pat Gelsinger wants to save Moore’s Law, with a little help from the Feds
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: The company is aiming to produce its first silicon wafers by 2028 and have its first commercial system online by 2029.

item.title: Meta reportedly delays mixed reality glasses until 2027
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: aMeta lready sells VR headsets and Ray-Ban smart glasses, but these new glasses sound a bit different. Their format factor would reportedly be similar to the Apple Vision Pro, with a puck-like power source.

item.title: Is it time to ‘refound’ your startup?
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Sometimes, founding a startup just once isn’t enough.

item.title: How would the Netflix-Warner Bros. deal reshape Hollywood?
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: It’s only been a day since Netflix announced an $82.7 billion deal to acquire Warner Bros., and the acquisition has already been described as sending Hollywood into “full-blown panic mode,” “possibly a death blow to theatrical filmmaking,” and maybe even “the end of Hollywood” itself.

item.title: Creator IShowSpeed sued for allegedly punching, choking viral humanoid Rizzbot
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Creator IShowSpeed sued after punching, choking viral humanoid Rizzbot.

item.title: After you check out your Spotify Wrapped 2025, explore these copycats
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal, Ivan Mehta
item.description: Spotify’s annual Wrapped feature just dropped, giving listeners a fun, personalized summary of their listening habits. It has gained immense popularity over the years, and as a result, many companies have seized the opportunity to create similar year-in-review experiences, offering users a recap of their habits, preferences, or interactions from the past year. Here are […]

item.title: Digital artist Beeple put his face on a $100K robot dog next to Elon Musk and Picasso – it sold first
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: The project marks at least the second time Winkelmann has become the art world's main character.

item.title: Ex-Googler’s Yoodli triples valuation to $300M+ with AI built to assist, not replace, people
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Yoodli counts Google, Snowflake, and Databricks among its customers.

item.title: Sources: AI synthetic research startup Aaru raised a Series A at a $1B ‘headline’ valuation
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: The one-year-old startup, which does market research on simulated populations, had a multi-tier valuation round, sources tell TechCrunch.

item.title: Waymo to issue software recall over how robotaxis behave around school buses
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: The voluntary recall comes as scrutiny by federal regulators and local school district officials increases.
